name: The Equus Hotel

reviews.text: If you want a four star hotel, pay the going four star price. If not stay here. Total refurbishment since my last stay very nice. Yes the trim on the elevator needs attention, but I believe the mechanicals had been totally rebuilt recently, prior visit it was clean but decidely run down . Now very clean room, quality linens new furniture and rebuilt baths, all tastefully done. This is a smaller hotel with ltd services, but location is ideal, five minutes from the beach and ten from Ala Moana Centre. The road noise is there, but in all fairness to the hotel there was a repaving project going on during the last week in Sep. The noise did subside after midnight. I suspect many other Waikiki hotels are equally noisy. If you want total quiet go stay at a resort out of town, Waikiki is in the middle of Honolulu folks. I paid 1/3 the going rate of a room at the Hilton Hawaiin village and pocketed the difference, as all I wanted was a clean bed. ABC store just up the steet (a Hawaiian 711) and Outback and Red Lobster are right across the street. Many other restaurants and bars in local area. Breakfast was continental, coffee, fruit and pastries, if you want more, stay elsewhere or pay for a full hot breakfast, it was not a big deal with me as I do not eat much breakfast as a rule. Very cooperative front desk staff unlike prior stay so that is a big improvement as well. An internet connection would have been appreciated, a computer is in the lobby but too pricey to use very long.
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel

reviews.text: The noisiest hotel I have EVER stayed in. Imagine sleeping in the middle of a freeeway during peak hour, and you get the idea. The breakfast is a joke, and the lift is basically falling apart. The only people that should stay here are the chronically deaf.
reviews.title: Bring the earplugs!

reviews.text: Our room was very clean with updated bathroom facilities. We only noted a few rare ants. Our biggest complaint was the significant road noise. The road noise from the busy street was relentless. It felt like I set up a tent on the curb. If you book this hotel, bring earplugs!
reviews.title: extreme road noise..bring your earplugs!

likes.liked: — easy bus connections to points of interest

reviews.text: I went to Honolulu for 2 weeks on a business trip in May. I wanted to find a reasonably-priced hotel for myself and a coworker in Honolulu, near the beach. I found the Aqua website, and chose the Equus to work best for us, after considering price, location, amenities, and appearance.
reviews.title: LOVED this hotel

likes.liked: — I loved the room, and the way it was decorated.
likes.disliked: — The low wall outside of the room door.

reviews.text: We had booked a special online price, and got a great rate ($100 average per night). We checked in late on a Saturday night. We were given our keys quickly, and given directions to park in another Aqua hotel next door. The lobby area was modest, and small, but nice-looking.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

likes.disliked: — Room was somewhat noisy due to view of busy street below and elevator was slow.

reviews.text: This was one of the worst places I have EVER stayed. There is NO iron or ironing board. There is NO hair dryer. The internet was DOWN and the electricity was out for about 6-8 hours. My room phone did not work. There are only about 10 channels on the TV. It is VERY loud there. I had booked 7 nights but left after 2 because it was so crappy. They charged my card $300 over what the 7 nights would be and NEVER told me and it is NOT on any paperwork that they give you. I told the clerk that we were not happy and she said, "well, you owe me this much.". They should not have charged us for the 2nd night. It was hot and miserable....
reviews.title: Never again..... Please be aware of this hotel!

likes.liked: — I liked the decor and the fresh smell of the room.The.size of the hotel and the reasonable price.
likes.disliked: — Poor sound proofing. Quieter rooms are in the back of the hotel,this helps with traffic noise but not with noisy guests.

reviews.text: Just returned from a very enjoyable trip to Hawaii. In Waikiki we stayed at the Equus and really liked it. First all the good things about it,the size, small and friendly,updated room very nicely done,the location is a bit out of the thick of things but in an area I like. We had an ABC store on the corner and a bus stop 1 block away.The room we had wasn't big (but not too small either)nor was the nicely tiled shower or bathroom. Almost the only complaint I had was that the sound proofing wasn't good. We weren't bothered at night but during the day the hotel was noisy.The lobby is very cosy and is used for the free continental breakfast, and provides a wonderful place for guests to mingle.I will include some pictures.
reviews.title: Love the room and cosiness

reviews.text: Not knowing much about Waikikii, we booked the hotel as it was close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. 5min walk.
reviews.title: Nice place great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, plus there was enough room for two weeks worth of shopping and bags. Coffee was provided, and a small mini fridge.
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.text: This is a small boutique hotel that has been recently remodeled. The rooms were very comfortable and the beds great! Nice details were included and complimentary water at check-in appreciated. The parking garage is a little difficult, as no way to go directly from hotel tower to parking. Ask for rooms away from Ala Moana Blvd., or the noise will get you! Great value for the money and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great rooms!

reviews.text: The hotel was recently renovated with a granite countertops and a huge comfortabe bed with tons of pillows. The tv was a flat screen Westinghouse and the room was always clean, with the hotel staff curtious and friendly. The downside is parking is expensive and will have to find a side street to park on. The hotel is walking distance from Wakiki beach. I was visiting friends so neither were an issue for me. Would definately stay again!!!
reviews.title: Great place to spend a week

likes.liked: — The huge comfortable bed and the lanai
likes.disliked: — traffic, parking, location decent-but within walking distance

reviews.text: I loved the renovations. The staff was wonderful. I would recommend this property.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Friendly staff and as said by others very comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Despite the difficult parking situation, construction and its one elevator that was very slow, I still would recommend the Equus.
reviews.title: Worth the low price

reviews.text: Close to everything, not ocean front, but works for the price.
reviews.title: Great Location Good services

likes.disliked: — for the rooms facing the street is traffic some noise, but not bad

reviews.text: Nice room, small continental bkfast, small pool, great rates, make a nice place to rest.
reviews.title: Over charged and over whelmed

likes.liked: — There were beds?!?!? Not too much to say here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoy Oahu
reviews.title: Reasonably priced, great location!

likes.liked: — Hotel room cleanliness, location, friendly staff

reviews.text: The hotel itself was very old and nothing like the pictures on expedia. When i first arrived the service was bad and so was the building, the elevators was probably the first ever installed on the island of Oahu it took atleast 15 minutes for it to arrive. Along with the rediculous wait for the elevator it was also nasty inside and all of the staff was using it also, we were riding the elevator with bags of leaking garbage. The condition of our room at first glance seemed slightly better than the rest of the building until i realized i was sharing the bathroom with a community of tiny red ants. Our room was also the closest to the road and the walls were very thin so i got lulled to sleep by the roar of cars and trucks, i kept checking the windows to make sure they were shut but it was just the poor construction of the building. The worst part of the whole experience was that i had paid for the hotel a month in advance but when i got home from the getaway the hotel had charged me almost 300 dollars, after talking to both expedia and the hotel staff no one could tell me where the charges came from or what they were for somehow they had no record of them but they were still on my card. It was a huge hassle to have the money matters cleared up and the hotel was in the wrong. Over all i do not recommend staying here, spend a little more money to go to a much more reliable hotel.
reviews.title: The truth about the Equus-A+

likes.liked: — Renovated comfortable clean rooms, great staff and price!
likes.disliked: — the pool-BUT the access to the aqua chain next door with it's pool made up for it!

reviews.text: My boyfriend is stationed at Schofield Barracks so I've been out there 3 times in the past year to visit. The Aqua Equus has by far been the best hotel out of the three I've stayed at. The room was neat and clean, had a very comfy bed and was just overall a nice place to stay. You don't spend much time in your hotel room but it's nice to be able to go back to a clean, quiet hotel room after a long day in the sun. Pro's and Con's . . . .
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel
NOISY
reviews.text: Its been said before but I didnt think a hotel could really be that noisy! I stayed in 3 different rooms and all were noisy. Outside road noise and continous slamming of door noise in the morning (must be the maids and people going for bkft). Beds are soft and only fullsize. The hotel rooms are nice and the air cond is quiet. Breakfast was only juice and coffee, no decaf, muffins and if youre lucky they bring out a fruit plate. Usually there were apples or bananas avl. You are a few miles to the heart of Waikiki, however you are within walking distance to a big mall. Pay for internet is avl in the lobby. There is no beach within walking distance. Tiny pool. Microwave avl outside the lobby.

We stayed at the Equus because our son had to have surgery at Kapiolani. We stayed for 10 days so we needed someplace under $100. At $90 a night, we were surprised to see how nice the entry and decor was (although after climbing the 10 or 12 steps to get up to the lobby numerous times a day we were a little annoyed) and enjoyed how clean the room was. But the parking was HORRIBLE. If you have children do NOT stay here. You have to go down the elevator, down the flight of stairs that they have no elevator for, walk around the corner, through a parking lot, take another elevator into the parking garage, and THEN you can load all your stuff into your car. It seriously took us 20 minutes to leave or return each time. Then each night, at exactly 3:20, the air conditioner beeped about 7 or 8 times. Each time I reported it to the front desk, they said they would "check on it". Everytime I asked about whether or not it had been fixed, they said they didn't know. Hmmm...If you can't keep track of what's fixed and what hasn't been fixed, what is the point of customers asking for something to be fixed? Just a waste of time. My 18 month old son woke up everytime it beeped and screamed for a few minutes.
reviews.title: Disappointed. Parking a hassle, staff seems to be confused all the time.

likes.liked: — rooms were fairly clean, cheap, close to ala moana
likes.disliked: — parking, confused staff, electronics w/ problems in the room, they don't wash your dishes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THEN...to top it off, I walked in while the cleaning people were there, just to grab something. The woman was wiping our cups out with a white washcloth! (I take it that it was one of ours, since I doubt that most cleaning companies use white hotel towels to clean rooms). After watching numerous dateline nbc-type specials on how hotels don't actually wash your cups anymore, I had told my husband not to use them. He thought I was just being paranoid. Hmmmm... After they left, I smelled both wine glasses (one we had eaten ice cream out of and the other we hadn't used.) One glass smelled faintly sweet with a slightly chemical odor, and the other smelled like nothing.
reviews.title: Won't be back

reviews.text: The internet also didn't work (which was a huge disappointment since my husband needed to work from the hotel while we were gone for the surgery) and the parking was almost $20 a night (which made our $90 hotel room not so cheap after all).
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Basically, if you like climbing stairs, don't have young children or much luggage, and don't mind dirty glasses or not getting a straight answer about simple questions like when the internet is going to be working (we basically got the response of..."It's not working" to our question of "When will the internet be working?"), then it's worth staying here. After all, if you'll be at the beach all day, you may not notice these things when you come back. So for that, it is worth the price. But $17 parking when you could valet park at another hotel for $20? I would definitely pay more to stay in a hotel that has more amenities than save a few bucks and get a headache in return.
reviews.title: What a Gem in Oahu

likes.liked: — The Staff and the Rooms and the Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms in this place were nice, comfortable, and clean. The service was awful and the room I had was right off the street and very loud, you could hear cars, music, and people all night long. This is not a hotel for any one who actually wants to sleep in their room.. Every morning around 8AM the maid would bang on the door with the cord to the vacum cleaner and see if you wanted your room to be cleaned if not they skipped it... You could hear the maids in the hallways from 8-2PM talking very loudly with music playing from their carts... I also asked the reception for information on getting a shuttle to the airport and he looked at me like I asked for his first born and handed me a phone book???
reviews.title: The worst, barely slept, bad service too...

reviews.text: We stayed at the Equus for a week in August and I would definitely stay there again. The rooms were clean, it was a pretty good location and value for money. Like other posters have said it is not a well-known location so make sure you have the address with you to find it. We just had to walk across the road to another hotel to get the tour buses so it was fine.
reviews.title: A Lovely Stay...

reviews.text: THE PROS - The staff were friendly - particularly the girl at the front desk whose name I can't remember - and let my sister check in early after she arrived feeling really sick. Also our air-con broke down one day and they fixed it right away. The room was nicely renovated and clean. It had the most comfortable beds and pillows we've ever slept on. The TV had about 40 channels. there's an internet computer in the lobby that just cost a few dollars to use. It was 5 minutes walk to Ala Moana shopping centre although a bit longer into Waikiki. there's an ABC shop on the corner and a McDonalds nearby as well as a few restaurants.
reviews.title: Awesome service

likes.liked: — the quality of the bed, and the comfort of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS - I agree with another poster that they could try to clean their rooms faster - we got back some days at about 4pm and our room still hadn't been done but that was a minor irritation. There was a bit of noise but we had the air-con on so that drowned it out. On the first morning we were there some kids were diving in the pool at about 6am but they were quickly told to stop. Also the toilets sound like airline toilets when they flush so you hear the neighbouring rooms flushing but you get used to it. lol. We had a room right down the hall from the check-in counter so I can't comment on the lift because we didn't use it. The only other downside I can think of is that we had to go to the Aqua property next door to do our laundry but housekeeping was using all the washers and dryers to do the sheets and towels so they should really have separate facilities for guests.
reviews.title: Excellent value for your Money!

likes.disliked: — Housekeeping done too late in the day

reviews.text: Apart from that it was a great stay and we would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Equus surprise...

likes.disliked: — The noise! Oh my gosh, I was glad when the traffic finally died down for the night!

reviews.title: Cozy hotel...
reviews.text: i loved my stay in room 206. the architecture was very warm and womb like. the staff was remarkable. mei was the sweetest woman i have ever met and mariah was very helpful in aiding our adventures beyond waikiki. i give this hotel 4 and a half stars and plan to return on my next trip to hawaii. i can't wait to see the hotel after the renovations are complete. a roof garden would really be a cherry on this supreme sunday .

Most of these reviews are right on target. Excellent rooms and beds, without any "resort frills". You won't beat it for comfort, style and cleanliness. However if you require a rotating restuarant, piano-bar, dinner show, spa and full-hot breakfast with your hotel, then the Equus is probably not for you. Other than that it's a great room to unwind and relax for another days activities.
reviews.title: Hard to Beat

likes.liked: — The Equus understands the real purpose of a hotel room. To rest and relax!
likes.disliked: — No view of anything, except the building next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those that insist on negatives.
reviews.title: It was Ok

likes.liked: — It's near the Aloa Mona shopping centre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The street traffic is noticeable even on the 8th floor.
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. You do have to walk to anywhere. ABC store or McDonalds is a 2 minute walk. Red Lobster and Outback Steakhouse are maybe 3 minute walks. Only because you have to wait to cross the street. I guess that's a negative? And the beaches really are a 10-15 minute walk.
reviews.title: Loved the King size bed!

reviews.text: If all you plan to do is hit the beach this is probably not the place for you. However, if you want 5-star comfort for a 2-star price. Equus is hard to beat.
reviews.title: Best Value in Hawaii

aka: The Equus Hotel And Marina Tower
description: The Equus is a charming boutique hotel located on Waikīkī’s “Upper West Side” where you will find an abundance of restaurants, easy access to one of the world’s largest shopping malls, a quick stroll to the beach and gorgeous sunset views. The hotel guestrooms are warm and contemporary, keeping true to the hotel’s equestrian theme with Ralph Lauren-inspired touches throughout. An intimate lobby and lanai offer a dipping pool, gazebo and a weekly cocktail reception.All guestrooms are appointed with cozy pillow-top beds, flat screen TVs, refrigerator with freezer, Keurig coffee maker with organic coffee, and complimentary full property WiFi. Portable printers can be delivered for those on business. Best of all, the friendly staff offers the kind of personal assistance delivered with Aloha that only a small, family-run hotel can offer.
